verses.verse: A Psalm for Solomon<WH8010>. Give<WH5414> the king<WH4428> thy judgments<WH4941>, O God<WH430>, and thy righteousness<WH6666> unto the king's<WH4428> son<WH1121>. for: or, of
He shall judge<WH1777> thy people<WH5971> with righteousness<WH6664>, and thy poor<WH6041> with judgment<WH4941>.
The mountains<WH2022> shall bring<WH5375> peace<WH7965> to the people<WH5971>, and the little hills<WH1389>, by righteousness<WH6666>.
He shall judge<WH8199> the poor<WH6041> of the people<WH5971>, he shall save<WH3467> the children<WH1121> of the needy<WH34>, and shall break in pieces<WH1792> the oppressor<WH6231>.
They shall fear<WH3372> thee as long as<WH5973> the sun<WH8121> and moon<WH3394> endure<WH6440>, throughout all<WH1755> generations<WH1755>.
He shall come down<WH3381> like rain<WH4306> upon the mown<WH1488> grass: as showers<WH7241> that water<WH2222> the earth<WH776>.
In his days<WH3117> shall the righteous<WH6662> flourish<WH6524>; and abundance<WH7230> of peace<WH7965> so long as the moon<WH3394> endureth. so long: Heb. till there be no moon
He shall have dominion<WH7287> also from sea<WH3220> to sea<WH3220>, and from the river<WH5104> unto the ends<WH657> of the earth<WH776>.
They that dwell in the wilderness<WH6728> shall bow<WH3766> before<WH6440> him; and his enemies<WH341> shall lick<WH3897> the dust<WH6083>.
The kings<WH4428> of Tarshish<WH8659> and of the isles<WH339> shall bring<WH7725> presents<WH4503>: the kings<WH4428> of Sheba<WH7614> and Seba<WH5434> shall offer<WH7126> gifts<WH814>.
Yea, all kings<WH4428> shall fall down<WH7812> before him: all nations<WH1471> shall serve<WH5647> him.
For he shall deliver<WH5337> the needy<WH34> when he crieth<WH7768>; the poor<WH6041> also, and him that hath no helper<WH5826>.
He shall spare<WH2347> the poor<WH1800> and needy<WH34>, and shall save<WH3467> the souls<WH5315> of the needy<WH34>.
He shall redeem<WH1350> their soul<WH5315> from deceit<WH8496> and violence<WH2555>: and precious<WH3365> shall their blood<WH1818> be in his sight<WH5869>.

And he shall live<WH2421>, and to him shall be given<WH5414> of the gold<WH2091> of Sheba<WH7614>: prayer also shall be made<WH6419> for him continually<WH8548>; and daily<WH3117> shall he be praised<WH1288>. shall be given: Heb. one shall give

There shall be an handful<WH6451> of corn<WH1250> in the earth<WH776> upon the top<WH7218> of the mountains<WH2022>; the fruit<WH6529> thereof shall shake<WH7493> like Lebanon<WH3844>: and they of the city<WH5892> shall flourish<WH6692> like grass<WH6212> of the earth<WH776>.

His name<WH8034> shall endure for ever<WH5769>: his name<WH8034> shall be continued<WH5125> <WH5125> as long as<WH6440> the sun<WH8121>: and men shall be blessed<WH1288> in him: all nations<WH1471> shall call him blessed<WH833>. endure: Heb. be his name shall be: Heb. shall be as a son to continue his father's name for ever
Blessed<WH1288> be the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, who only doeth<WH6213> wondrous things<WH6381>.
And blessed<WH1288> be his glorious<WH3519> name<WH8034> for ever<WH5769>: and let the whole earth<WH776> be filled<WH4390> with his glory<WH3519>; Amen<WH543>, and Amen<WH543>.
The prayers<WH8605> of David<WH1732> the son<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> are ended<WH3615>.
